references.paper_title: Spatio-temporal data mining: A survey of problems and methods
references.reason: This paper provides a comprehensive survey of spatio-temporal data mining, establishing a foundational understanding of the field and highlighting key challenges addressed in the target paper.

references.paper_title: Traffic4cast at neurips 2022-predict dynamics along graph edges from sparse node data: Whole city traffic and eta from stationary vehicle detectors
references.reason: This paper introduces the Traffic4cast 2022 competition, which motivates the research presented in the target paper by highlighting the challenge of learning from highly sparse spatio-temporal traffic data.

references.paper_title: On the unreasonable effectiveness of feature propagation in learning on graphs with missing node features
references.reason: This paper analyzes the effectiveness of feature propagation for handling missing data in graphs, providing a theoretical basis for understanding the limitations of iterative methods and motivating the proposed one-step approach in the target paper.

references.paper_title: BRITS: Bidirectional recurrent imputation for time series
references.reason: This paper introduces BRITS, a baseline method for time-series imputation that the target paper compares against, demonstrating the effectiveness of the proposed method compared to existing techniques.

references.paper_title: Inductive graph neural networks for spatiotemporal kriging
references.reason: This paper introduces IGNNK, another baseline spatio-temporal imputation method that is compared against the proposed method, showcasing the advantages of the proposed approach in handling highly sparse data.
